How This Started

January 2024: I needed a website for a side project. I read 20+ "best AI website builder" reviews.

Every single one listed the same 5 tools. All had 4.5+ star ratings. All had affiliate links. All felt... identical.

The problem: I tried the #1 recommended tool.

  • ✗ Export didn't work—trapped my content
  • ✗ AI content hallucinated features that don't exist
  • ✗ "Free plan" was basically unusable

The realization: I tried the second recommendation. Same story. Third, fourth—they all had issues that none of the reviews mentioned.

These weren't reviews. They were SEO-optimized affiliate bait written by people who'd never actually used the tools.

So I started doing my own testing.

Properly. Spending actual time with each tool. Building real sites. Documenting the problems. Sharing screenshots of the bugs. Not getting paid to say nice things.

Full Transparency

Most review sites are SEO content. This is actual testing.

Not a 30-minute demo. I build actual complete websites from scratch. Real content. Real pages. Real problems documented.

2

Loading issues, bugs, confusing UX, hidden limitations—I tell you about all of it. Including screenshots.

3

Affiliate links are disclosed

I use affiliate links, but I'll still tell you if a tool sucks. Commissions don't buy my opinion.

4

I re-test regularly

Tools change. I update reviews to reflect current reality, not what was true 6 months ago. Scores go down too.

Full Transparency

My Biases (What I'm Bad At)

I have preferences and blind spots like anyone else. Here's what you should know about my perspective:

✗

Things I Penalize

✗

I'm biased toward design quality

Tools that generate ugly sites get lower scores from me, even if they're functional. Aesthetic matters.

✗

I hate vendor lock-in

Tools that trap your data get penalized. I believe you should own your code and content.

✗

I'm not a WordPress fan

I find it bloated and slow. This affects how I review 10Web. WordPress lovers might disagree.

✗

I penalize confusing pricing

Hidden fees, bait-and-switch, "free" plans that aren't—these hurt scores significantly.

✗

I haven't used every tool for months

I do intensive testing initially, then check back periodically. Things might have changed.

✓

Things I Reward

✓

I value speed & efficiency

Tools that save me time get bonus points. Durable's 30-second generation impressed me.

✓

I care about performance

PageSpeed scores matter. Framer's 98/100 mobile score is a big reason it scored 9.3.

✓

I'm honest about affiliate links

I mark them clearly. They don't influence my scores—I'll bash a tool that pays well if it sucks.

✓

I've been wrong before

Check the reviews—I've updated scores when tools improved or when I missed features.

✓

I reward transparency

Tools that are honest about limitations score higher than ones that overpromise.

! What I've Gotten Wrong (Corrections Welcome)

Initial 10Web score was too low: I originally scored 10Web at 7.5 because of PageSpeed issues. After reader feedback pointing out the WooCommerce value, I re-tested and bumped it to 8.8. The e-commerce features are exceptional even if performance is mediocre.

Underrated Relume initially: I treated Relume as just a wireframing tool. Readers pointed out it's the best sitemap planner available. Updated the review to reflect this. It's now 8.9.

If you think I've missed something or gotten something wrong, email me: hello@aiwebsitebuilders.com. I'll investigate and update if warranted.

The Hard Truth About AI Builder Reviews

Most "review" sites are just affiliate bait. Here's how they work:

1

They've never used the tools

Most review sites rewrite the same marketing copy. They haven't built a single site. They're aggregating features, not testing reality.

2

They never mention problems

Every tool is "amazing" and "perfect." No loading issues. No bugs. No limitations. That's not testing—that's marketing.

3

They rank by commission, not quality

The #1 recommended tool is almost always the highest-paying affiliate commission. Not the best tool. The most profitable one.

4

They never update reviews

Tools change rapidly. Most reviews are written once and never updated. Scores from 2023 get presented as current reality in 2026.

This site is different.

I actually use these tools. I document the problems. I update scores when things change (up AND down). Affiliate links don't buy my opinion.

Common Questions

Actual questions I get asked. Actual answers.

Do you make money from this site?

Yes, through affiliate links. But here's the difference: I'll still tell you if a tool sucks. I've given low scores to tools that pay high commissions because they deserve it. Commissions don't buy my opinion—they just fund the testing.

How do you choose which tools to review?

I focus on AI website builders with actual traction—tools that real people are considering. I also review tools that readers request. If there's a tool you want tested, email me and I'll add it to the list.

Why do some tools have such low scores?

Because they're bad. Loading issues, poor design, confusing UX, hidden fees, vendor lock-in—these are real problems that affect your experience. I'm not going to recommend a tool just because it pays well.

How often do you update reviews?

Every 3-6 months I re-test major tools. Between those cycles, I update when tools make significant changes (good or bad). Scores go up AND down based on current reality.

Can I trust your recommendations?

Use them as one data point, not gospel. I'm trying to be honest and thorough, but I have my own biases and preferences. Your mileage may vary. Read the full reviews, look at the screenshots, and decide for yourself.

Who funds this testing?

Affiliate commissions pay for the hosting and the time I spend testing. No tool has paid me for a review. No tool has sponsored content. I buy my own subscriptions.

What's your background?

I'm a freelancer who builds websites for clients. I've used every major website builder (traditional and AI) over the years. I got tired of fake reviews and decided to do real testing.

WHY THIS SITE EXISTS

THE PROBLEM WITH "REVIEWS"

Search "best AI website builder" and you'll find hundreds of "review" sites. They all look the same. They all say the same things. They all have affiliate links to every builder (even the bad ones).

Why? Because they earn commissions when you click. They don't care if you choose the right tool—they care if you click ANY link. So they recommend everything. 5 stars here, 4.5 stars there, everyone's a winner!

That's not reviewing. That's affiliate link farming with extra steps.

WHAT I DO DIFFERENTLY

I actually use these tools. Not for 5 minutes, not for a demo. I build real websites. I run into the real problems you'll encounter. I document the specific limitations, not generic pros/cons.

I call out bad products. Bookmark AI charges $99/month for features worth $29. I'll say that. Mixo has great templates but terrible e-commerce. I'll tell you. Wix has beautiful designs but sluggish performance. I document it.

I rank products honestly. Some tools score 9/10. Others score 6/10. Some don't even make the list. Not every tool deserves a recommendation.

Real reviews require real opinions. Not "everything's great 5 stars."

MY TESTING PHILOSOPHY

Test for real use cases: I don't just click through demo templates. I build sites for actual scenarios: portfolios, small businesses, e-commerce, blogs. The stuff YOU need to build.

Measure what matters: PageSpeed scores, build times, feature limitations, pricing reality. Not "it has a nice UI" (subjective) but "it loads in 1.2 seconds" (objective data).

Document the problems: What breaks? What gets frustrating? Where do you hit paywalls? What sucks and why? The negative review is more valuable than the glowing one.

Good reviews help you avoid bad tools. Great reviews tell you the truth.

WHAT I'VE LEARNED FROM 127+ HOURS OF TESTING

MOST "AI" ISN'T AI

Most AI website builders just use AI to fill templates with your content. The "AI" is a text generator. The design, layout, structure—all pre-built templates. There's nothing wrong with that, but call it what it is: template-assisted site building, not revolutionary AI.

SPEED MATTERS MORE THAN FEATURES

Builders with 1,000 features often feel bloated and slow. Builders that do one thing well (Framer for design, Durable for speed) feel better to use. The tool that gets your site live in 30 minutes beats the tool that promises everything but takes 3 hours to figure out.

CODE EXPORT IS PREMIUM

Being able to export your code and host anywhere is freedom. Being locked into a platform is a trap. Always check: can I leave? If the answer is "no" or "only if you rebuild everything," that's a red flag.

PRICING IS OFTEN ARBITRARY

Bookmark charges $99/month for features worth $29. Framer charges $15/month for superior design. The market isn't efficient—brand positioning and perceived value drive pricing more than actual feature value. Always compare alternatives before committing.

THE BEST TOOL DEPENDS ON YOU

There's no universal "best" AI website builder. Framer for designers, Durable for speed, 10Web for e-commerce, Relume for planning. The right choice depends on your skills, budget, timeline, and goals. Anyone who says "this is the best for everyone" is selling you something.

HOW TO USE THESE REVIEWS

READ THE FULL REVIEW, NOT JUST THE SCORE

A 9/10 score means nothing if you don't know WHY. Read the detailed findings. Look at the specific use cases. Check if the pros matter to YOU. The score is a summary—the details are where decisions happen.

TEST YOUR TOP 2-3 CHOICES

Most builders offer free trials or cheap plans. Actually use them. Build a test page. See how the interface feels. Your experience might differ from mine. 30 minutes of hands-on testing beats 3 hours of reading reviews.

THINK ABOUT EXIT STRATEGY

Before committing to any platform, ask: can I leave? If I outgrow this tool, can I export my content? Can I migrate to WordPress? Can I download my designs? The best time to think about leaving is before you arrive.

REVISIT YOUR CHOICE ANNUALLY

The AI website builder space moves fast. New tools launch monthly. Existing tools add features. Prices change. What was best last year might be middling this year. Re-evaluate annually—you might find better options.

THE BOTTOM LINE

This site exists because I got tired of fake reviews and affiliate link farms. I wanted actual data from actual testing. Real screenshots, real measurements, real problems documented.

I'm not perfect. I have biases and preferences. But I'm trying to be honest about what these tools actually do, not what their marketing claims.

If these reviews help you avoid one bad tool or choose one good one, they've done their job. That's the whole point.

ABOUT AI WEBSITE BUILDERS
Why This Site Exists

I spent 6 months testing every AI website builder so you don't have to. This site is the result of real testing, actual data, and brutal honesty about what these tools can actually do. No affiliate hype, no sponsored reviews, just the truth.

WHO'S BEHIND THIS?
No Corporate Agenda

My Background

I'm a web developer who spent 10 years building custom websites. Then AI builders showed up and claimed to make websites in 30 seconds. I was skeptical.

So I tested them. All of them. Over 6 months, I built 200+ websites using 25+ AI builders. I tracked what worked, what didn't, and what was pure marketing.

This site is my documentation of that process. Everything here is based on actual testing, not promotional materials.

My Approach

  • 🔬 Real testing: I actually built sites, didn't just read marketing copy
  • 📊 Data-driven: Measured load times, SEO scores, content quality
  • 💰 Transparent funding: Affiliate links, but I'd recommend these tools anyway
  • 🎯 No sponsorships: No paid placements, no sponsored reviews
  • 🔄 Updated regularly: I re-test quarterly as tools evolve

TESTING METHODOLOGY
How I Evaluate AI Builders

🚀

Speed Test

Time from prompt to published website. Actual seconds measured.

What I measure:

  • • Prompt to generation
  • • Edit time
  • • Publish process
  • • Total time investment

🎨

Quality Assessment

Design quality, content readability, mobile responsiveness.

What I measure:

  • • Visual design score
  • • Content quality rating
  • • Mobile optimization
  • • Overall polish

⚡

Performance

Load times, Core Web Vitals, Lighthouse scores.

What I measure:

  • • Page load speed
  • • Mobile speed
  • • Lighthouse score
  • • Core Web Vitals

🔍

SEO Evaluation

Technical SEO, content SEO, schema markup, mobile-friendliness.

What I measure:

  • • Meta tags quality
  • • Heading structure
  • • Schema markup
  • • Mobile SEO

💰

Pricing Analysis

First-year pricing, renewal rates, hidden costs, value for money.

What I measure:

  • • First year cost
  • • Renewal increase %
  • • Hidden fees
  • • Feature value

😊

User Experience

Ease of use, learning curve, frustration points, delight factors.

What I measure:

  • • Onboarding clarity
  • • Editor intuitiveness
  • • Help quality
  • • Overall frustration

AFFILIATE DISCLOSURE
Transparency Matters

How This Site Is Funded

This site contains affiliate links. If you click through and purchase an AI website builder, I may earn a commission. This doesn't cost you anything extra—it's how the platform pays me for sending them a customer.

⚠️ Important

Affiliate commissions don't influence my reviews. I'd recommend the same tools regardless. The commission just lets me spend time testing instead of consulting.

My Affiliate Policy:

  • ✅ I only recommend tools I've actually tested: No promoting based on commission rates
  • ✅ No paid placements: Nobody can buy a positive review
  • ✅ Honest flaws included: I list limitations even for top-rated tools
  • ✅ Regular re-testing: I update reviews as tools change
  • ✅ No fake urgency: No "limited time" affiliate tricks

Commission Rates (for transparency):

AI website builders typically pay 30-50% commission on first-year sales, sometimes recurring. This is standard in the industry. I don't choose tools based on commission—I test based on what users need, then check if they have an affiliate program.

WHY AI WEBSITE BUILDERS MATTER
The Problem They Solve

The Old Way

  • ❌ Custom development: $5,000-50,000, 2-6 months
  • ❌ Traditional builders: Wix, Squarespace take weeks to learn
  • ❌ WordPress: Powerful but overwhelming for beginners
  • ❌ Agencies: Expensive, slow, communication overhead

The AI Way

  • ✅ 30-second generation: From prompt to published website
  • ✅ Intelligent content: GPT-4 quality copy written for you
  • ✅ Low cost: $10-40/mo vs thousands upfront
  • ✅ No technical skills: Describe what you want, get it

The Reality: AI builders aren't perfect. But for 80% of websites, they're perfectly adequate and 100x faster than the old way. That's why I created this site—to help you find the right AI builder for your specific needs.
